page.title: 05Stone Parish Church
page.content: From the very top of St. Michael's Church tower you can see some of the sights of Stone and Meaford. You can see Christ Church and St. John's Church.In the distance Meaford Power Station can be seen.St.Michael's Church dates back to the 7th century.At that time it was called the Church of St.Mary & St.Wulfad.It was changed to St.Michael's in 1758 but nobody knows why this was done.The original church was mentioned in the Domesday Survey in 1085.The Frank Jordan Centre used to be the old St.Michael's School before 1971.In 1971 St.Michael's C.E. Primary School was moved to the present site in Weaver's Lane.The Frank Jordan Centre is used as a Sunday School for St.Michael's Church and is also a community centre.The Sunday services are 8.00am, 10.30am & 6.30pm. The Rector is Fr. Bill Spray.
